results.title: Everything in life
results.creator_credit: Tudor Films, George Loftus and J. Elder Wills
results.brief_description: A musical comedy about a European musical star who comes to England to make a film. She refuses the script offered and storms out of the office bumping into a would-be author who thinks she has been sacked. Not knowing who she reeally is, romance ensues. Stars Gitta Alpar and Neil Hamilton.

results.title: Everything and nothing
results.brief_description: A thought-provoking documentary based on a one-to-one intimate discussion with the director Jayce Salloum (This is not Beirut, Introduction to the end of an argument) and Soha Bechara, a Lebanese National Resistance fighter. Born in Beirut in 1967, Soha speaks candidly and openly about her life and experiences living and growing up under Israeli occupation, of joining the Lebanese National Resistance Movement (Jabhat al Muquawama al Watanieh Lubnaniya) in 1986, of her capture by the Israelis in 1988 and her forced detention for the next ten years in the Khiam detention centre in South Lebanon until her eventual release on September 3, 1998. Reflective about the past, Soha’s thoughts however are with the future and maintaining a strong commitment to carrying on the “political, economical, social and cultural struggle” for the ones who still remain in the detention centre and for the liberation of Lebanon from Israeli occupation. The interview solely takes place in Soha’s Paris room one year after her release. A poignant and sensitive film enhanced by the intimacy and interaction between filmmaker and subject. Note: No title or credits appear in the film.

results.title: Everything about bicycles
results.brief_description: By following the ups and downs of an animated ‘everyman’ we see the bicycle’s history and evolution, its maintenance and riding in a great variety of situations.

results.title: Everyone says I love you
results.creator_credit: Buena Vista Pictures, Magnolia Productions, Miramax Films, Sweetland Films BV, Charles H. Joffe, Jack Rollins, Robert Greenhut and Woody Allen
results.brief_description: This story of a very well off family living in New York takes the audience on a journey through their daily lives, highlighting the high and lows. The basic family set-up involves the two parents, Bob (Alan Alda) and Steffi (Goldie Hawn), four daughters, a son, a grandfather, and Joe (Woody Allen) - Steffi’s ex-husband. Joe is still very much a part of the family and regularly visits from his home in Paris. Joe seems to have had an endless array of failed relationships, and continuously pines for his ex-lovers. Meanwhile, the eldest daughter, Skylar (Drew Barrymore) is deeply in love with Holden (Edward Norton). Music and an ensemble performance drive the intertwined love stories, which revolve around the members of an extended blended family. The story structure is almost a dance of life that continuously circles around in a cycle of love found, lost, and then found again. The disparate story elements are unified by the use of the narrator DJ (Natasha Lyonne), who is the college-age daughter of Steffi by a previous marriage to Joe. Like almost everyone else in the film, DJ is a romantic at heart who seems to be always falling in and out of love. In addition to narrating, she acts as cupid in helping Joe meet Von (Julia Roberts), a woman he has fallen in love with at first sight. All the principal actors are given at least one song, and with the exception of Drew Barrymore, do their own singing rather than have the voice of a professional singer dubbed in.

results.title: Everyone Dreams to Win a Medal
results.brief_description: Scenes of courage and determination are shown in this inspirational film about young disabled athletes competing in a variety of sports at the Disabled games in Canberra.

results.title: Everyone's full bottle now
results.creator_credit: Australian Broadcasting Corporation and Simon Target
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “The Academy”.
The Academy looks at life as a new cadet at ADFA - the Australian Defence Force Academy in Canberra. “Full bottle now” introduces Ilana Napier, a new cadet who leaves her family and home to spend three years training at ADFA and the struggles and challenges she experiences. This is also an important time at ADFA because they are undertaking a new experiment with training whereby new cadets will be trained by staff instead of by third year cadets. Kizzy Hyde shares her experiences and takes the viewer on a tour of the barracks as a third year cadet.

results.title: Everynight...everynight
results.brief_description: Ray Mooney wrote and produced his stage play which put life in H Divsion Pentridge under the microscope. It is shot in black and white; the gritty nature of which underpins the brutality and bleakness of the prison and its inmates. Dale, a remand prisoner and notorious hitman, is thrown into H Division where he is subjected to beatings, relentless mind games and mental cruelty at the hands of the warders led by Berriman. Despite the efforts to break his spirit, Dale becomes a law unto himself in order to survive. This film is an indictment of systems. Systems which are open to abuse, to corruption; systems where police can behave like criminals and get away with it. Systems which can alienate and deprive people of their dignity to the extent that violence is a power seeking device from men who have never known influence or affluence. Stars: David Field, Bill Hunter, Robert Morgan. Festivals and Awards: Nominated Best Director (Alkinos Tsilimidos), Best Adapted Screenplay (Ray Mooney and Alkinos Tsilimidos), AFI Awards, 1994; Jury Prize, Best First Film, Montreal Film Festival, 1994; Official Selection, Venice Film Festival, 1994.
